summary: This is an internal email chain from Reuters regarding the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell by the FBI on July 2, 2020, on charges related to Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a forwarded news article summarizing the arrest, Maxwell's background, and the context of Epstein's prior arrest and death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite and heiress, confidante of Jeffrey Epstein, arrested by the FBI on Epstein-related charges for allegedly helping him traffic underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Disgraced financier and registered sex offender who was arrested in 2019 on federal charges of exploiting underage girls; died by suicide in custody in August 2019.

persons.name: Robert Maxwell
persons.context: Father of Ghislaine Maxwell, mentioned as a media baron.

persons.name: Jonathan Dienst
persons.context: Co-author of the News 4 New York article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Joe Valiquette
persons.context: Co-author of the News 4 New York article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Tom Winter
persons.context: Co-author of the News 4 New York article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Sarah Fitzpatrick
persons.context: Co-author of the News 4 New York article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's confidante and one-time girlfriend, alleged to have helped him groom teen girls for sex.
Robert Maxwell is the father of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI on the East Coast on Epstein-related charges and was expected to appear in federal court later that day.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in custody in early August 2019, following an arrest on federal sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Epstein's arrest and suicide attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested last summer on federal charges of exploiting underage girls and attempted suicide in custody in late July 2019.

events.title: Defamation suit against Maxwell
events.description: A teen victim filed a defamation suit against Ghislaine Maxwell in 2015, alleging she helped Epstein groom girls for sex.

events.title: Epstein deposition transcript release
events.description: A federal appeals court released the transcript of a 2016 deposition in which Epstein repeatedly refused to say whether Maxwell had procured young girls for him.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI on July 2, 2020, on Epstein-related charges.
Maxwell was accused in a civil suit of allegedly helping Jeffrey Epstein traffic underage girls.
Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in custody in August 2019 while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking charges.
Two guards tasked with monitoring Epstein face federal charges for not properly supervising him before his death.
A 2016 deposition transcript showed Epstein repeatedly refused to say whether Maxwell had procured young girls for him.
